response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "Being 20 years old is associated with a higher likelihood of recidivism as younger individuals statistically tend to have higher rearrest rates."],
    ["Ethnicity", "medium", "Identification as Hispanic has been variably associated with risk levels in different studies; socioeconomic context can influence outcomes."],
    ["Arrest History", "high", "Three prior arrests, even without convictions, indicate a pattern of interaction with the criminal justice system and elevate risk."],
    ["Physical Attributes", "low", "Height and weight do not directly correlate with criminal recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital Status", "medium", "Never having been married can indicate less stability in personal relationships, moderately increasing risk."],
    ["Living Arrangements", "low", "Not living alone may suggest the presence of a support network, which can reduce risk."],
    ["Education", "medium", "Having only a high school diploma and not being enrolled in further education can limit opportunities, moderately contributing to risk."],
    ["Employment", "high", "Holding four jobs in a year suggests employment instability, a known risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Drug Use", "high", "Recent use of substances like marijuana and cocaine is strongly linked to higher recidivism risk due to potential behavioral and legal issues."],
    ["Depression", "medium", "Persistent depressive symptoms can influence decision-making and behavior, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Childhood Environment", "medium", "Growing up in an urban setting in a moderate-sized household can expose individuals to higher risk environments, moderately affecting outcomes."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "Attributing personal outcomes to divine will may provide coping mechanisms and social support, representing a protective factor."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Being 20 years old is associated with a higher likelihood of recidivism as younger individuals statistically tend to have higher rearrest rates.
Identification as Hispanic has been variably associated with risk levels in different studies; socioeconomic context can influence outcomes.
Three prior arrests, even without convictions, indicate a pattern of interaction with the criminal justice system and elevate risk.
Height and weight do not directly correlate with criminal recidivism risk.
Never having been married can indicate less stability in personal relationships, moderately increasing risk.
Not living alone may suggest the presence of a support network, which can reduce risk.
Having only a high school diploma and not being enrolled in further education can limit opportunities, moderately contributing to risk.
Holding four jobs in a year suggests employment instability, a known risk factor for recidivism.
Recent use of substances like marijuana and cocaine is strongly linked to higher recidivism risk due to potential behavioral and legal issues.
Persistent depressive symptoms can influence decision-making and behavior, contributing moderately to risk.
Growing up in an urban setting in a moderate-sized household can expose individuals to higher risk environments, moderately affecting outcomes.
Attributing personal outcomes to divine will may provide coping mechanisms and social support, representing a protective factor.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 3 times but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 5 inches and weighs 210 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 4 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and most of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
